com.thalesgroup.gemalto.d1

Class D1Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thalesgroup.gemalto.d1.D1Task

  • public class D1Task
extends Object
    Main class for D1 use cases.

    NOTE:
    It is recommended to initialize D1Task as soon as the application is launched or the earliest possible time.

    NOTE:
    Risk API contains session ID internally. The session ID is used by backend to identify the user's activity. The lifecycle of session ID is linked to the D1Task lifecycle, i.e. one D1Task instance uses same session ID for all the use cases.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  D1Task.Builder
      An object that constructs D1Task from its configurations.
      static interface  D1Task.Callback<T>
      Generic callback to return result of an asynchronous call

    • Method Detail

      • getSDKVersions

        @NonNull
public static Map<String,String> getSDKVersions()
        Returns SDK version(s) in the D1 SDK.
        Returns:
        Dictionary with SDK name as key and SDK version as value, e.g. {"NuDetect": "2.0.0"}

      • startAnalyze

        public <T extends ComponentCallbacks> void startAnalyze(@NonNull
                                                        RiskParams<T> params,
                                                        @NonNull
                                                        D1Task.Callback<Void> callback)
        Start monitoring of events for the current page. This method should be called at the start of the page or when the app resumes to foreground, e.g. in Activity.onResume()

        NOTE:

        • Other risk APIs, such as pauseAnalyze(), stopAnalyze(Callback) should only be called after the callback succeeds.
        • The callback result is running on the main thread.

        NOTE:
        Possible error:

        • D1Exception.ErrorCode.ERROR_RISK: caused by no internet connection, incorrect risk credentials.

        Category - Risk API

        Type Parameters:
        T - The object type to do the analyze.
        Parameters:
        params - The risk parameters for analyzing.
        callback - The start result callback. The callback parameters for both D1Task.Callback.onSuccess(Object) and D1Task.Callback.onError(D1Exception) are @Nullable.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Exception when the param type is not in the supported list.
        See Also:
        RiskParams

      • pauseAnalyze

        public void pauseAnalyze()
        Pause the monitoring. This method should be called when the page navigates to the next page (during a multi-page scenario) or when the app goes into background, e.g. in Activity.onPause()

        Category - Risk API

      • stopAnalyze

        public void stopAnalyze(@NonNull
                        D1Task.Callback<byte[]> callback)
        Stop monitoring the events for the current page. This method should be called to get the risk payload. Once having the payload, integrator should send it to their backend, to be used in risk assessment call to D1 backend.

        NOTE:
        The callback result is running on the main thread.

        NOTE:
        Possible error:

        • D1Exception.ErrorCode.ERROR_RISK: caused by incorrect risk credentials.

        Category - Risk API

        Parameters:
        callback - Callback to retrieve the risk payload or error. The callback parameters for both D1Task.Callback.onSuccess(Object) and D1Task.Callback.onError(D1Exception) are @Nullable. If success, the returned payload byte[] is already in JSON format. Integrator can convert it to a String as new String(payload, java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets.UTF_8)}
